title: Maxime Mbanda
text:
Mata Maxime Mbanda (born 10 April 1992) is an Italian <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. His usual position is as a flanker, and he currently plays for <a href="Zebre">Zebre</a>. Known for his ball carrying and athleticism.
Early career.
For <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Pro12">2015–16 Pro12</a> season, he named as "Permit Player" for <a href="Zebre">Zebre</a> in <a href="Pro%2014">Pro 14</a>.
In 2013 Mbanda was named in the <a href="Italy%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy Under 20</a> squad and in 2014 and 2015 he was also named to the <a href="Italy%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Emerging Italy</a> squad.
Professional career.
After a string of favourable performances, the No. 8, was selected to represent, the <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italian national team</a> in a test-match in <a href="San%20Jose%2C%20California">San Jose, California</a>, during <a href="2016%20June%20rugby%20union%20tests">Summer International tests</a> against the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. Italy won with a result of 24 to 20. Since then Mbanda has been a regular in the Italian national side, featuring in the <a href="2019%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2019 Rugby World Cup</a>, in <a href="Japan">Japan</a>.
Personal life.
During the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Italy">COVID-19 pandemic in Italy</a>, Mbanda volunteered for the Yellow Cross, a humanitarian organization in <a href="Parma">Parma</a> that transports food and medicine for the elderly. On 3 June 2020 the President of Italy <a href="Sergio%20Mattarella">Sergio Mattarella</a> named Mbanda a Knight of the <a href="Order%20of%20Merit%20of%20the%20Italian%20Republic">Order of Merit of the Italian Republic</a> for his services as a volunteer ambulance driver.
